# Selected Metropolitan/Micropolitan Area Risk Trends (SMART)

## Organization
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

## Website
https://www.cdc.gov/brfss/smart/Smart_data.htm

## Description
* Provides localized health information that can help public health practitioners identify local emerging health problems, plan and evaluate local responses, and efficiently allocate resources to specific needs.
* Uses BRFSS data to provide prevalence rates for selected conditions and behaviors for cities and their surrounding counties.

## Vintage/Release Frequency
Annual since 2006

## Observational Unit
Metropolitan/micropolitan statistical areas (MMSAs)

## Collection Methodology
CDC analyzes BRFSS data to obtain these estimates. View detailed methodology at https://www.cdc.gov/brfss/annual_data/2021/pdf/2021_SMART_BRFSS_MMSA_Methodology-508.pdf

## Available at
https://www.cdc.gov/brfss/smart/Smart_data.htm

## User Guide/Data Dictionary
Available for each year on same site as data download

## Cost
Free

## Proposal or Application required?
No

## DUA required?
No

## Special Notes
* An aggregated file with data from 2011 to present is available at https://chronicdata.cdc.gov/Behavioral-Risk-Factors/Behavioral-Risk-Factors-Selected-Metropolitan-Area/j32a-sa6u
